Soldiers - The only problem I have with using Charge is you to 
continiously back way from enemies to use it.  On the other hand, 
charge is a nice way to retreat in a hurry.

mages - if you get to the point where you can freeze time, the game 
becames a breeze.  Or if you convert your mage to an archmage, you 
should have no worries once your archmage can summon images/fire 
elementals.

A cloaked thief is an easy enemy to defeat?  I do not think so.

skeletons are difficult to beat because of their speed and tunneling 
ability.

A really powerfull ghost can scare away a cleric before the cleric can 
turn it undead.

Faeries are really usefull against mages and archmages.

Level 30 potion of speed makes you go faster than level 10 potion of 
speed.  Going too fast can be a severe disadvantage at times.  I might 
make a scenario just to illustrate that point.
